fadd2aae1157.name: B. Isabel

paragraphs.name: b1f8
paragraphs.text: We don’t talk about it because it’s the hardest thing to talk about. People spend so much energy trying to keep the black holes in their lives a secret, but now all of mine is spent trying to survive. When I came out of the closet about being diagnosed with type II Bipolar Disorder, an Internet troll mocked me: “my mental illness makes me special.” Instantly he confirmed my lifelong fear — the fear of my feelings being bad! I felt discredited and patronized. And, even worse, the fear of people accusing me of seeking some sort of special treatment or pity. I don’t want your pity. I want the respect of being listened to. I’ve put too much time and money into self-care for you to doubt my diagnosis, or worse, belittle it.

paragraphs.name: b1f8
paragraphs.text: We don’t talk about it because it’s the hardest thing to talk about. People spend so much energy trying to keep the black holes in their lives a secret, but now all of mine is spent trying to survive. When I came out of the closet about being diagnosed with type II Bipolar Disorder, an Internet troll mocked me: “my mental illness makes me special.” Instantly he confirmed my lifelong fear — the fear of my feelings being bad! I felt discredited and patronized. And, even worse, the fear of people accusing me of seeking some sort of special treatment or pity. I don’t want your pity. I want the respect of being listened to. I’ve put too much time and money into self-care for you to doubt my diagnosis, or worse, belittle it.

We were hardly apart for the next eight months, and I glowed and radiated until I could no longer sustain it. As quickly as I ignited, I smoldered. My breath sat like smoke over my rotting body for over a year. “Where do you go” he asked, “when you sink into yourself like that?” There’s always been a storm behind these sunny eyes, and now I was stuck in the eye of it. Anytime I smiled, I could feel another piece of me pulling at the reigns, like the moon dragging the sun back below the horizon so darkness can take over once again. I couldn’t talk about it. My whole life had been spent trying to camouflage my crazy.
paragraphs.name: c1f5
274b
paragraphs.text: But something else happened, too. People thanked me. They had questions and stories and together we had strength. I helped a few people begin the process of getting psychiatric service dogs. A few weeks later, I was an active listener for someone across the country attempting suicide. My relationship with my family improved. I think I showed them that they no longer needed to sugar coat their feelings. If having a mood disorder means learning how to love myself and build stronger relationships, then I will happily shed my skin of shame and sanity. I will proudly wear my badge of Bipolar Disorder. My name is Ashley, I’m mentally ill, and I want to talk about it.

paragraphs.name: e428
paragraphs.text: Eventually I grew out of the clothing sensitivity, but I became more susceptible to emotional disturbance. At my seventh birthday party, all of the neighborhood kids stood around the dining room table to watch me open presents, dropping crumbs of cobbler out of their absent-minded mouths. I was happy that their attention was divided. Quietly I thanked each person for their gift and crunched the scraps of wrapping paper into a trash bag, worrying that if I did this too loudly, I would wake them from their daydreams that were saving me from the spotlight.

paragraphs.name: 32f3
paragraphs.text: Hope everything’s OK. Take care of yourself. Looks like from the responses here that you’ve got a lot of folks out there rooting for you :)

virtuals.subtitle: My seventy four years have convinced me that no one is “normal”, some less so than others.

paragraphs.name: 1d26
paragraphs.text: Keep holding on Ashley. Life is worth it. You are worth it. Thank you for bravely sharing your story. Your writing is poignant and real. We are listening so, please, keep on sharing.

paragraphs.text: thank you.

paragraphs.name: 343d
paragraphs.text: this was amazing.

37b17b907654.title: Your story is painful to read, but at the same time, it is extremely powerful.

paragraphs.name: b34d
paragraphs.text: Your story is painful to read, but at the same time, it is extremely powerful. And you, Ashley Corbett, are very brave.

dda4a71985cd.title: This has to be the most intense piece I’ve read recently.

paragraphs.name: 7cac
paragraphs.text: This has to be the most intense piece I’ve read recently. Words and comments won’t do justice thanking you for your bravery in putting your heart out this way. I don’t have any advice or comforting words. But I couldn’t leave this page without saying (or leaving a small mark) that says I read it and heard you. I am not sure “thank you” is suitable…

virtuals.subtitle: You are evolving and healing is a process, always a process — sometimes to be celebrated, other times to be allowed to rest or to cry.

e239ac272ba6.title: Have a look at the “me” in “mentally” and the “I’ll” in “ill.”

content.subtitle: You are evolving and healing is a process, always a process — sometimes to be celebrated, other times to be allowed to rest or to cry.

paragraphs.name: 48b5
paragraphs.text:
Have a look at the “me” in “mentally” and the “I’ll” in “ill.” 
“This is ME and I’ll keep telling my story, keep listening to other stories, keep healing, healing healing healing healing and healing….”

paragraphs.name: 9e4b
paragraphs.text: You are evolving and healing is a process, always a process — sometimes to be celebrated, other…

af9d7add8769.title: I’ll probably remember this sentence for the rest of my life.

paragraphs.name: 71d7
paragraphs.text: I’ll probably remember this sentence for the rest of my life.

cf5fc2c23ac4.title: Your courage shall surely inspire others to begin on a healing path aslo.

paragraphs.name: 134d
paragraphs.text: Your courage shall surely inspire others to begin on a healing path aslo. It has reminded me to honour my own sadness, as well as those close to me & my children so we can be whole, not fragmented and disconnected . Thank you. I hope you keep writing.

c6e354fa9426.title: Thank you for your courage to share your story.

paragraphs.name: b36a
paragraphs.text: Thank you for your courage to share your story. To be vulnerable and brave. To be daring and courageous. I appreciate your presence and your words. I don’t think there are enough words to express my gratitude. You shared your journey with beautiful words, I could picture the events in my mind. You have a gift!

b3e0e2eb2e97.title: And I want to listen, Ashley.

paragraphs.name: f846
paragraphs.text: And I want to listen, Ashley. With no judgment or advice. I have my own demons — PTSD, OCD and eating disorders. I’m receiving treatment for them. I wish you the very best and I want to hear everything you have to say. xo

eeed08c3cc05.title: But, the beauty of it, is that you don't have to!

paragraphs.name: eae2
paragraphs.text: But, the beauty of it, is that you don't have to! The beauty of other people's opinions on you, is that they're just other people's opinions: they have no effect on you; only their actions can have an effect on you. Your opinions of yourself, though, they can have an effect which can be constructive or destructive. That's whence the "don't let them get to you", which can be so annoying, draws its truth.

paragraphs.text: THIS is what courage looks like. Thank you for being so brave and sharing this part of your insides with us. It is 8:15am and after reading this, I feel like I can walk into my day more transparent, more fully me. You inspired me to better live my truth, whatever that may be. Thank you.

paragraphs.text: People have told me that it takes nerve to speak your mind but it takes courage to speak from the heart. I was diagnosed with high functioning autism in my late teens. My years in school were hell because I didn’t know how to relate to other kids or understand certain lessons teachers taught. I was picked on by both, yes both. I’m fairly certain the…

Smiles and ease to those with depression. Keep trying and always seek help. There is a beautiful field of love and flowers out there for everyone.

paragraphs.name: 44b2
paragraphs.text:
If it makes you feel any better. most of us are mentally ill and want to talk about it. We all have issues with ourself, work, identity, family, spouse, friends. Some of us have issues that we can’t share with anyone. 
People look happy. Only God knows if they are actually happy

content.subtitle: No matter how pathetic you feel you feel yourself to be, no matter how low you ever believe you are, you will never in a million years be…

paragraphs.text: Something to remember: you didn’t choose your spiritual and psychological hitches — but trolls deliberately choose to be evil.
No matter how pathetic you feel you feel yourself to be, no matter how low you ever believe you are, you will never in a million years be as pathetic as people who choose to mock and taunt someone…

6fec4d07fffa.title: Wow, I literally got goosebumps from that sentence.

paragraphs.text: Wow, I literally got goosebumps from that sentence. Thank you so much for talking about it. My wife has had trouble with depression on and off for her entire adult life, and the hardest part for me is to see her live her life among scores of other people who don’t truly understand what it’s like to live with it (myself included). Thank you so much for doing your part to break the stigma that “sad is bad”.

f9f7ea4dfc01.title: Beautiful piece. Thank you for sharing. x
